title: Workshop: How to Draw in Museums—Drawing the Hairy Who, Part II
hero_caption: Jim Falconer, Art Green, Gladys Nilsson, Jim Nutt, Suellen Rocca, and Karl Wirsum. Hairy Who, 1966. Gift of Gladys Nilsson and Jim Nutt.
short_description: Part two of a two-part program presented with the Smart Museum of Art.
list_description: Part two of a two-part program presented with the Smart Museum of Art.
description:
In the second part of this program presented by the Smart Museum of Art and the Art Institute of Chicago, delve deeper into the fearless work of the group known as The Hairy Who in the exhibition, Hairy Who? 1966–1969. We’ll investigate works by Jim Falconer, Art Green, Gladys Nilsson, Jim Nutt, Suellen Rocca, and Karl Wirsum and practice various drawing techniques, including the game “Exquisite Corpse,” collaborative comic-book making, and using motifs in your own work.

This program is open to all skill levels and materials will be provided. Space is limited and registration is required.

Presented by the Smart Museum of Art and the Art Institute of Chicago.
location: Meet at the entrance of Gallery 124
buy_button_caption:
Free with museum admission

Museum admission is free for Illinois residents every Thursday, 5:00–8:00—including during this event.
